data.name: Working from Home - Lunchtime Beer
data.description:
When working from home, a coder can often treat themselves to a lunchtime beer. Or two... This tastes great, but later in the afternoon can really damage concentration levels.

Given a piece of work (work) and a number of lunchtime beers (beer), you must return the number of hours the work will take to complete. 

*I'm off to get a beer to drink while I finish writing this kata*

The potential work items and their non-beer timescales look like this:

```
Mini-project --> 3 hours
Project --> 6 hours
Large project --> 9 hours
New App --> 12 hours
Re-factor legacy codebase --> 96 hours
```

Each working day has 7 hours (to make it easy, and give you a lunch break). 3 hours in the morning, 4 hours in the afternoon (post lunch/beer).

Beer will only slow down work for the rest of the day it is consumed (day 1), the following day the coder will be fresh again.

Beers slows work as follows:

```
1 --> 10%
2 --> 20%
3 --> 35%
4 --> 50%
5 --> No more work that day
```

You have to return the total amount of hours it will take to complete the given project.
